intro: Dolichogyne acaulis, commonly known as the leafless spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its lack of true leaves, with photosynthesis occurring through its stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Dolichogyne acaulis is a member of the family Commelinaceae, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants.
